metadata.title: CVE-2017-9815 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In LibTIFF 4.0.7, the TIFFReadDirEntryLong8Array function inlibtiff/tif_dirread.c mishandles a malloc operation, which allows attackersto cause a denial of service (memory leak within the function _TIFFmallocin tif_unix.c) via a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9815` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.3
libtiff-tools - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.3
libtiff5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.3
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.6-1ubuntu0.3').
